revised_title: Chemical Intensity of Daylight and its Variations at Kew and Para
tldr: This article presents the results of a two-year study on the chemical intensity of daylight at Kew Observatory and Para under the Equator. The study found that the mean chemical intensity for hours equidistant from noon is constant, and the daily maximum of chemical intensity corresponds to the maximum of the sun's altitude. The author also discusses the probable causes of the autumnal maximum in chemical intensity and the differences in chemical intensity between tropical and temperate regions.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Atmospheric Science
